text:
We are proud to share that the Quality Control Laboratory at our Raipur plant has been accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration (@NABL_QCI), under Quality Council of India (@QualityCouncil)  

This significant achievement means that test results from our lab will now be acceptable globally, considered equivalent to accreditations received by MRA (Mutual Recognition Agreement) partners of International Laboratory Accreditation Corporation.

#ShreeCement #BangurCement #BuildSmart

We are proud to share that the Quality Control Laboratory at our Ras plant has been accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL), under Quality Council of India.

This significant achievement means that test results from our lab will now be acceptable globally, considered equivalent to accreditations received by MRA (Mutual Recognition Agreement) partners of International Laboratory Accreditation Corporation.

@NABL_QCI @QualityCouncil 

#ShreeCement #BuildSmart #Innovation #Excellence #TechnologyNews #UPDATE

In the first quarter of FY25, we continued on our growth journey by optimising our production processes, enhancing cost efficiencies and maintaining a strong focus on branding initiatives. These efforts enabled us to consistently deliver value to our stakeholders. https://t.co/2Jj8UWpyOc

We are happy to announce Shree Cement's strong Q4 performance, highlighted by a record full year operating EBIDTA of ₹4364 crore, up by 48%YoY. With Q4 revenue surging 7% to ₹5101 crore YoY and PAT jumping 21% to ₹662 crore YoY, our momentum is undeniable. As we ambitiously target 65.8 MTPA capacity by March’25, with a robust investment of ₹4500 crore, the Board's recommendation of a 550% final dividend for FY24 reflects our commitment to shareholder value.

#ShreeCement #Q4Performance #BuildingTheFuture #Growth #SustainableGrowth

Our MD Mr @NeerajAkhoury sharing his insightful comments with @ETNOWlive on the solid quarterly results beating all expectations.
Reasoning out this positive result, he attributed Shree Cement’s comprehensive performance improvement plan, strong volume growth along with building premium products through accelerated channel expansion and softening of fuel prices that has helped #ShreeCement to deliver a robust improvement.

Shree Cement Limited, closed its Q2 and H1, ending September 30, 2023, with EBITDA growth of 66% and PAT growth of 159%. It continues to deliver strong financial performance on the back of the increase in volume growth and enhanced operational efficiency. #ShreeCement https://t.co/uS8XWOytQd

Shree Cement reports a 31% increase in net profits in Q4 results #WeAreShree
